content:
What a lovely idea! The Met and Central Park are both iconic NYC destinations, and walking between them is definitely doable.

The Metropolitan Museum of Art is located on the Upper East Side, and Central Park is just across the street from the museum. The walking distance between the two is approximately 0.5 miles (about an 8-10 minute walk).

To get to Central Park from the Met, simply exit the museum and head east on 82nd Street towards Fifth Avenue. Continue straight on Fifth Avenue for about 4 blocks, and you'll reach the park's entrance at 82nd Street and Fifth Avenue.

The walk is relatively flat and easy, with plenty of scenic views of the park and the city. You'll pass by the beautiful Conservatory Garden, the Alice in Wonderland statue, and the Loeb Boathouse along the way.

If you're feeling tired or prefer not to walk, a taxi ride would take around 5 minutes and cost approximately $10-$15, depending on traffic.

Considering the short distance and scenic route, I'd recommend walking from the Met to Central Park. You'll get to enjoy the beautiful surroundings, take in the sights and sounds of the city, and get some exercise to boot!

Just remember to stay hydrated, wear comfortable shoes, and be mindful of pedestrian traffic and street performers along the way. Have a wonderful stroll!
